Product Title: Delonghi super-automatic espresso coffee machine with an adjustable grinder, double boiler, milk frothermaker for brewing espresso, cappuccino, latte, macchiato & Flat white. ECAM44660B Eletta
Review Description: I posted a 1 star review originally, but have changed to 4 after the original machine was replaced in 24 hours.  Our first machine had some kind of manufacturing defect where the water 'drawer' was jammed into the machine. We managed to get it out to fill with water for the first attempt but we couldn't get the drawer back in and it got so jammed we couldn't get it in or out.  No amount of heaving (with two adults) could move it. I'm familiar with DeLonghi coffee machines (office has an older version) and so I don't think this was user error.The second machine arrived soon after and worked beautifully (the drawer smooth and faultless).DeLonghi UK customer support has no telephone number and responded with a receipt for my request for help, but no follow up, although to be honest this all happened in the days preceding Christmas. There appears to be very little support for when things go wrong, potentially because they rarely go wrong and we were unlucky with or first machine.

Product Title: Delonghi super-automatic espresso coffee machine with an adjustable grinder, double boiler, milk frothermaker for brewing espresso, cappuccino, latte, macchiato & Flat white. ECAM44660B Eletta
Review Description: This is an excellent coffee machine, and a worthy upgrade to my old Coffee Garcon machine that has finally been put into retirement. It's very sleek, compact and well put together - it certainly looks the part in my kitchen. I do have a few tiny gripes with it however. Firstly, there doesn't seem to be any indicator to display the level of beans in the machine - as far as I can tell, the only way to determine this is to check manually. It's only a very minor quibble however. Equally minor is the fact that the drink sizes are offered in cup sizes rather than actual volumes - my old machine let me just set a volume of coffee each time, which I really liked. This may just be my preference however, and I can see how the cup sizes may be useful for others.There are some really great features in this machine that are a big upgrade from my old one. One thing is really like is the milk frother - it's much easier and cleaner than the old pipe system. In terms of coffee making, it's also pretty quick as far as coffee machines go. One bugbear that I've always had with coffee machines is that the coffee isn't quite hot enough - I'm really pleased to say that this DeLonghi machine has a noticeably higher temperature than other machines I've used and is pretty much spot on.Overall, a wonderful little machine, and perfect for household use.

Product Title: Delonghi super-automatic espresso coffee machine with an adjustable grinder, double boiler, milk frothermaker for brewing espresso, cappuccino, latte, macchiato & Flat white. ECAM44660B Eletta
Review Description: This has replaced my old Delonghi coffee machine that had stopped working after many years of service and has proven to be a great upgrade. The initial setup was a little daunting but the end results were worth it.It took a bit of trial and error to find the grinding and temperature settings to my taste, but now I can quickly make a fantastic flat white in the morning with minimum fuss. Also, the removable milk container that can be easily popped in the fridge between uses to keep it fresh is an ingenious feature.All in all, after the almost off-putting initial learning curve, I am impressed with the resultant coffees that this machine makes.

Product Title: Delonghi super-automatic espresso coffee machine with an adjustable grinder, double boiler, milk frothermaker for brewing espresso, cappuccino, latte, macchiato & Flat white. ECAM44660B Eletta
Review Description: The best way to think about this is a scaled-down version of the machines you see in Starbucks - more suited for a domestic kitchen than a busy coffee-shop. It is theoretically possible to recreate every single Starbucks-style coffee - cappuccino, latte, macchiato, etc. I personally am a latte drinker myself. However - you can only really do one such coffee at a time - a significant difference between a domestic-machine, and a coffee-shop machine. This was not a particular problem as far as I was concerned, although it might be an issue if you, say, had to cater for a large dinner party.So really this is an expensive luxury, although the coffee produced *is* high quality.On the practical side, this is a rather large item, which has to be couriered. I also appreciated the fact that by registering the product DeLonghi will apparently give it a free service when the time comes.
